messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Terry Smithwick <Tinyallen@...>
wrote:
>
> QS is admittedly not a true phonetic alphabet and
> already has two mergers, the stressed-unstressed pairs
> Schwa and the other one. <Can't find my reference just
> now . . .>
>
> As one who merges all three of the 'problem'
> letters, I lack knowledge to answer one important
> question:

> How strongly phonemic for how many people is the
> Awe/Ox distinction?
>

I also notice that few other spelling reform programs have 3 letters
for the Ah, Awe, Ox groups. Unifon does not and, most interestingly,
the venerable "New Spelling" which John Wells contributes to, does not.



A slight simplification of Ah / Awe / Ox has some real advantages:

-It would reduce the variations in spellings across accents. (Paul's
post titled "mergers in dictionary, in news." is a very timely and
pressing subset of this issue)

-It may solve the alphabetization problem.

-Having the extra letter provides no benefit: even those who hear the
Thought-Lot (Awe-Ox) difference are not benefited by having separate
letters for those two.

-Too few people will differentiate between Awe-Ox to make it worth
while: in practice most writing is going to merge two of these vowels
anyway.

-It would be surprisingly clean to merge and explain and maintain
readability with older writing.



To have it work, one would only need to do the two things numbered below:

1. Use Awe for the THOUGHT, CLOTH and LOT lexical sets when they do
not merge with PALM.

- In some accents, THOUGHT will not be merged with LOT yet they will
be using the same letter for both. There are already some QS letters
that play a dual role so I do not think this is a terrible burden.

- One problem is that the current assignment of lexical sets is in
fact pretty descriptive of actual current usage. By moving some sets
to Awe we make them proscriptive instead.


2. Declare Ox to be an alternate form of Ah. This will:

- Provide a fair degree of compatibility to texts already written
using Ox for LOT and CLOTH. (not that there are many such texts)

- Provide the benefit of more possibilities for connecting letters to
the Ah sound.

- Slide it out from its destructive position in the alphabet.

(Notice that declaring Ox to be an alternate form of Awe provides no
greater backward compatibility yet does not convey any benefit to senior.)



Although this is a separate issue which has nothing to with Ah /
Awe / Ox, it would then be possible to switch the alphabetical order
of Ice and At thereby producing a nicely coherent letter ordering.


All of this is pretty dramatic and takes a very creative reading of
the QM to justify but it is at least food for thoth(sic).
